plugins.name: Figma Instance Mode
plugins.description:
Inspired by this post: Please add an "Instance Selection" mode - Share an idea - Figma Community Forum


üî∂ Introducing Figma Instance Mode


- ‚§¥Ô∏è Select Instance

- ‚úÖ Instance Mode On

- üö´ Instance Mode Off


‚§¥Ô∏è Select Instance


check if there is a parent or ancestor instance with your selection, and then will redirect your selection to the instance


It is the same as the official feature named `select instance`, but with this plugin you can blind a hotkey to this feature.


‚úÖ Instance Mode On


Once you run this command, every time when you change your selection in Figma will run the `‚§¥Ô∏è Select Instance` command automatically which means you will always select the instance if your selection is within a instance.


And there will be a inspect window to show the program running result, you can get information with it.


üö´ Instance Mode Off


This feature is to turn off the instance mode, and close the inspect window


üî∂ How to add GLOBAL SHORTCUT in MacOS


Check the tutorial: Custom-shortcuts-in-figma by Jussi Virtanen


MacOS Global Shortcut Path:


Plugins->Saved plugins->Figma Instance Mode->‚§¥Ô∏è Select Instance


Plugins->Saved plugins->Figma Instance Mode->‚úÖ Instance Mode On


Plugins->Saved plugins->Figma Instance Mode->üö´ Instance Mode Off

accepted.name: RyanHuang üëÄ
accepted.description:
üî∏ Product Designer
üî∏ Heavy user of Figma
üî∏ Beginner in FE

plugins.name: Frontify Template Checker
plugins.description:
This plugin checks your Figma designs and highlights potential issues before uploading them as templates into Frontify. It‚Äôs designed to improve your template creation and management experience ‚Äî making the integration between Figma and Frontify more seamless.


Issues

We‚Äôre continuously refining and expanding the list of checks. This initial release focuses on the most common issues, with more to come. As we improve template import capabilities, some checks may also be retired.


  1. Auto-layout frames
  2. Layers with multiple fills
  3. Frames with image fills
  4. Text case transformations
  5. Image filters
  6. Mixed text styles within a single text element
  7. Unsupported elements
  8. Empty pages
  9. Slice layers
  10. Flip transformations
  11. OpenType features
  12. Hanging punctuation


Support

If you come across issues not currently covered by the plugin, please contact your Customer Success Manager or email us at support@frontify.com.

accepted.description: With our best-in-class brand management platform, Frontify is on a mission to create a home where all brands can thrive.

plugins.tagline: A simple tool to help you prepare your template for Frontify, right within Figma.

plugins.name: CSS Variables to Figma
plugins.description:
Import css variables into Figma variables

This plugin enables you import color variables from CSS into Figma, supporting both single-mode and dual Light/Dark mode setups. It maps your CSS variables to Figma's variable modes, converting formats like OKLCH (Tailwind), HEX, RGBA, and RGB into Figma-compatible HEX values. OKLCH, P3, and HCT color values are also preserved and attached to each variable for reference.


Example:


.light {
--color-primary: #000;
}
.dark {
--color-primary: #fff;
}


How it works:

  1. Paste your CSS variables in the text area below.
  2. Click "Export to JSON" to generate a Figma-compatible variables file.
  3. Import the JSON file into Figma using the Figma Variables by Honza Toman


Watch video‚Üí how it works.


Currently supported:

  1. Color variables
  2. Attach oklch, p3 colors and HCT values to variable syntax


Next updates:

  1. Border radius variables
  2. Spacing variables
  3. Shadows
  4. ...


Feedback and support

  1. Let us know your feedback and suggestions! @sans_sherif
  2. Support the development of this plugin buy us a coffee ‚òï
plugins.tagline: Import existing css variables to figma variables

plugins.name: Ai Design Review
plugins.description:
Transform Your Design Process with AI-powered Insights


Ai Design Review is a cutting-edge Figma plugin designed to help designers optimize their work by providing AI-driven design reviews. With this plugin, you can instantly analyze your designs and receive suggestions for improvement based on best practices in typography, layout, color schemes, accessibility, and overall visual consistency.


By utilizing AI technology, Ai Design Review helps you ensure that your designs adhere to industry standards, making your workflow more efficient and your designs more polished. The plugin automatically scans your design file, analyzes it against key design principles, and highlights potential issues, offering actionable insights and suggestions to improve the design's quality and user experience.


Whether you're a solo designer or part of a design team, Ai Design Review will serve as your AI assistant, providing real-time feedback to enhance your design‚Äôs impact and usability.


Key Features:

Automated Design Analysis: Instantly scan your designs for inconsistencies, color imbalances, accessibility issues, and more.


AI-Driven Recommendations: Receive intelligent suggestions for design improvements tailored to your project.


Customizable Feedback: Choose the types of design elements you want to receive feedback on, such as typography, spacing, or color.


Efficient Workflow: Save time and enhance collaboration by automatically detecting and fixing common design mistakes.


Boost your design efficiency and improve your work with Ai Design Review ‚Äî your AI-powered design assistant.
plugins.tagline: Enhance your designs with AI-powered insights for better quality and consistency

plugins.name: Figma to Cape Template Designer
plugins.description:
Seamlessly Copy Figma Designs to Template Designer


üöÄ Copy layers and frames from Figma directly into Template Designer.

üé® Save time by avoiding manual recreation‚Äîcopy, paste, and edit instantly.

‚ö° Keep your workflow fast and efficient, focusing on design instead of tedious adjustments.

üîÑ Easily update and edit imported layers, plus create unlimited formats.


Perfect for designers who want to work smarter. ‚ú®


How to Use the Plugin

1 Select a frame or layer in Figma and click ‚ÄúCopy‚Äù in the plugin.

2 Open Template Designer and paste with ‚åòV (or Ctrl + V on Windows).

3 Edit, update, and create multiple formats effortlessly!


Features

‚úÖ Save Time & Work Efficiently

Skip the hassle of recreating designs‚Äîcopy from Figma and start building immediately.

‚úÖ Editable Layers

Make changes to text, images, and more within Template Designer.

‚úÖ Unlimited Formats

Create multiple formats from a single design.

‚ö†Ô∏è Keep in Mind

Some advanced Figma styling elements may not be fully supported.


What is Template Designer?

Template Designer is part of Campaign Designer from Cape, a powerful tool for creating templates that generate multiple creatives. Designers can set up dynamic layers, allowing campaign managers to edit text, images and many more elements easily‚Äîmaking creative production faster and more scalable.


FAQ

What can I do with the plugin?

Quickly transfer your Figma designs into Template Designer without losing time on manual recreation.


Can I edit designs after pasting them?

Yes! You can edit imported layers, adjust elements, and create different formats.


Which elements are supported?

Most Figma layers, including text, shapes, and images. Some advanced styling may not be fully compatible.


What if I encounter an issue?

Let us know at Cape Support‚Äîwe‚Äôre happy to help! ‚ö°Ô∏è


This plugin helps designers work faster, update designs easily, and create scalable templates. Try it now and boost your workflow! üöÄ
plugins.tagline: Transform Figma Designs into Template Designer templates

plugins.name: Copy Paste Overrides
plugins.description: A tiny tool that does exactly as described. Useful when working with nested instances. Let's say you have a component that contains a list of items. You are working in an instance of that component and want to switch item 1 with item 2 on the list. You cannot do that because reordering of items is not supported within an instance. But what you can do is just copy and paste the overrides from item 1 to item 2 and vice versa. You're welcome!

plugins.tagline: Copy the overrides of an instance and paste them onto another instance to replicate it

119945.name: Copy Paste Overrides
119945.description: A tiny tool that does exactly as described. Useful when working with nested instances. Let's say you have a component that contains a list of items. You are working in an instance of that component and want to switch item 1 with item 2 on the list. You cannot do that because reordering of items is not supported within an instance. But what you can do is just copy and paste the overrides from item 1 to item 2 and vice versa. You're welcome!
119945.release_notes:
You can copy and paste overrides for component properties from one instance onto another.

Known limitations:
- nested instances don't fully work
- only overrides for specified properties are copied (for example a text that is changed without it being a property won't be copied)
119945.tagline: Copy the overrides of an instance and paste them onto another instance to replicate it

plugins.description:

A powerful tool for designers and developers to connect Figma components with codebase resources, making design handoff seamless.


Dev Resource Management

  1. Add, edit, and delete development resources for components
  2. Link multiple resources to individual components and variants
  3. Manage resources with custom names and URLs

Metadata Management

  2. Import metadata to restore or transfer component links
  3. Support for both individual components and component sets

plugins.name: Find Word Duplicates Ninja
plugins.description:
Find Word Duplicate Ninja is your reliable assistant for quickly spotting and managing duplicate words within your designs.


Key Features:


Duplicate Word Detection:

Instantly find duplicate words across all text layers.


Automatic Highlighting:

Automatically highlights all occurrences of duplicate words for easy identification.


Customizable Settings:

Adjust minimum word length to match your specific project needs.


Seamless Navigation:

Click a duplicate word tag to navigate directly to all its occurrences within your design.


Intuitive User Interface:

Stylish, user-friendly interface with well-designed tags for optimal usability.


Performance Optimized:

Efficiently handles large files without slowing down Figma's performance.


Why Choose Find Word Duplicate Ninja?


Boost Productivity:

Quickly catch duplicate words, save time, and streamline your workflow.


Improve Consistency:

Ensure consistent text throughout your project without any overlooked duplications.


Easy to Use:

Intuitive and straightforward interface suitable for designers of all levels.

accepted.description: UI/UX designer crafting Figma plugins for creatives and efficiency seekers.

You can use them freely for personal and commercial projects, with no attribution required.

plugins.name: Conjure - AI based text generator
plugins.description:
Introduction


Use your OpenAI API key with this plugin to quickly generate text for your designs. The plugin can allows to generate multiple text layers based on the content. Furthermore, it can also group the layers by their names, allowing you to use the layer names in the prompt to further elaborate how you want the data to be filled in.


How to use


The plugin was primarily created for 2 use cases:


1. Generate variations of a single type of data:

  1. Select all the text layers that show the same type of data and you want to generate variations of it. Imagine Name, City, Stock price, etc.
  2. Make sure 'Group by layer name' is OFF.
  3. Add details to the prompt to explain the type of content you want to be generated for the selected fields. Giving examples and formatting is also helpful.
  4. Click generate and it will fill the information!



2. Generate variations of multiple types of data:

  1. Select all the frames or components that you want to fill using this plugin.
  2. Turn ON 'Group by layer name'. The plugin will show you the layer names found.
  3. Add details to the prompt to explain the type of content you want to be generated for the selected fields. You can use the layer names to add specific context. Giving examples and formatting is also helpful.
  4. Click generate and it will fill the information!


3. Generated related data

You can use the group by layer name to select singular text layers which are related. An example is when you need text for First name, Last name, DoB, role, location and relatives. The plugin will try to generate related content for these layers.


Note


1. This plugin needs an OpenAI API Key to work.

2. I will recommend naming your text layers appropriately if you plan to use the Group by layer name feature. You can use it without naming the layers, but sometimes this might result in unexpected results.
plugins.tagline: OpenAI powered text generator with batch text generation feature

üé• Watch Tutorial | üì± Follow Us


Key Features:

  1. Smart Bookmark Groups: Organize your bookmarks into custom groups for different project sections, components, or workflows
  2. One-Click Navigation: Jump between bookmarked locations instantly with beautiful smooth animations
  3. Visual Labeling: Color-code your bookmarks and groups for quick visual recognition
  4. Notes & Documentation: Add helpful notes to bookmarks for team collaboration
  5. Drag & Drop Organization: Easily reorder bookmarks within groups
  6. Search Functionality: Quickly find any bookmark or group using the search feature
  7. Custom Animation Settings: Adjust transition speed and style for comfortable navigation


Perfect For:

  1. UX/UI designers working with large design systems
  2. Design teams collaborating on complex projects
  3. Product designers managing multiple component states
  4. Anyone working with extensive Figma files


How It Works:

  1. Select any elements you want to bookmark

plugins.name: Text Color Pairs To Variables
plugins.description:
Usage

  1. Create a frame with any name.
  2. Inside the frame created in step 1, create another frame named variableColorItem.
  3. Inside variableColorItem, create a frame named variableColor.
  4. Set a fill color for variableColor.
  5. Within variableColorItem, create a text layer named variableName.
  6. Select the frame you created in step 1.
  7. Launch the plugin.
  8. Click the button.
  9. The color of variableColor will be registered as a local variable under the name variableName.

plugins.name: Figma variables to Penpot tokens by Detachless
plugins.description:
Figma variables to Penpot tokens by Detachless

This plugin bridges the gap between Figma's design system variables and Penpot's design tokens, allowing seamless migration of your local variables.


How It Works

The plugin connects to Figma's Variables API to extract local variable collections and transform them into Penpot's token format. Here's the process:


  1. Collection Discovery: Upon launch, the plugin scans your Figma file for all variable collections and presents them in a selectable list.
  2. Intelligent Mapping: The converter handles various Figma variable types (colors, numbers, strings, booleans) and maps them to Penpot's token system, including:
  3. Variable mode conversion to Penpot themes
  4. Proper handling of variable references
  5. Special formatting of colors (HEX and RGBA)
  6. Nested structure preservation
  7. Token Organization: The plugin creates a structured Penpot token JSON with:
  8. Themes based on your variable collections and modes
  9. Proper metadata for Penpot compatibility
  10. Dependency management between collections
  11. Clean Output: The result is a downloadable JSON file ready to be imported into Penpot's design system.


Something is not working or you have suggestion for new feature? Submit feedback

This plugin makes it easy to find text that has had "Cap Height to baseline" vertical trim applied with the click of a button.

It's a useful tool to find and fix incorrectly applied text trims.


How to use:

  1. Click the button on the page you want to search.
  2. Click on trimmed text to select it and modify manually.
  3. Click the button again to confirm the text no longer appears in results.


Tips for fixes:

  1. Be careful when changing trim settings to "Standard" as it may cause layout shifts.
  2. Start by fixing text with the "Main component" tag first.

plugins.name: Sync Variables with Notion
plugins.description:
Synchronizes variables from a Notion database to a Figma document's Variable Collection. This is particularly useful for managing application text in Notion or supporting multiple languages.


üî• How to use


Sync collection tab

Connects a Notion database to a Figma Variable Collection and synchronizes their values. Settings are saved per Figma document.


1. Database ID

Specify the Notion database ID (Reference).


2. Integration token

First, create a new integration in Notion (Reference). Next, grant your integration page permissions (Reference). Enter the copied token.


3. Key property name

Specify the name of the Notion property that serves as the unique key for the variables (e.g., Name, Key, ID). Currently, title, formula, and text properties are supported as keys.


4. Collection name to create or update

Specify the name of the Figma Variable Collection to sync with. Existing local collection names will be suggested via autocomplete. If the specified collection doesn't exist, it will be created.


5. Add or reorder modes

Specify the Notion property names that correspond to Figma Variable Modes. These properties will hold the variable values for each mode (e.g., language).


  1. Adding modes:
  2. Enter a mode name in the textbox (e.g., ja, en, or other property names in your Notion database).
  3. Click the "Add" button to add it to the list.
  4. Reordering modes: Modes in the list can be reordered via drag and drop. This order will be reflected in the order of Figma variable modes.
  5. Removing modes: Click the X icon to the right of each mode name to remove that mode from the list.


After entering the information for steps 1-4, click the "Sync variable collection with Notion" button to start the synchronization. This process might take some time depending on the number of items in the database and the variables.


List tab

About list tab

Displays variables from the selected Collection. Only STRING type variables applicable to TEXT_CONTENT are shown. You can copy keys and values, and filter the list by key or value. Clicking on a row reveals the button described below.


"Apply variable to selected text" button

Select text layers in Figma and click the button to apply the variable.


Display mode

Select the Variable Mode (e.g., language) to display its corresponding values in the list.


About caching

When the target collection is a library collection, this plugin caches its information in client storage. This is done because fetching library collections with many variables can be time-consuming and might hit Figma's API rate limits. Clicking the "Refresh" button clears the cache and fetches the latest variable data.


Utilities tab

Provides several utility actions to help manage variables and their application to text layers.


Target collection

Select the Variable Collection to target for the actions. You can choose a collection or all collections.


Target text range

Select the scope for the actions: "Selection", "Current page", or "All pages". You can also choose whether to include text layers within components ("Include text within components") or instances ("Include text within instances") using the respective checkboxes.


Limit variable name

Optionally, enter text here to limit the "Bulk apply variables" action to only those variables whose names contain the specified text.


"Bulk apply variables" button

Automatically applies variables to text layers within the selected range. It matches text content with variable values across all modes in the target collection(s).


"Highlight applied variables" button

Visualizes variable usage on text layers. Text layers with variables applied are highlighted in blue, while those without are highlighted in red.


üìÆ Support

If you have any problems or feedback, please use the GitHub Issues.


===


This plugin was created by Ryo Nakae üôé‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è.


https://brdr.jp

https://x.com/ryo_dg

https://github.com/ryonakae

132062.release_notes:
- Refactored code to improve processing speed and stability
- Fixed an issue where caching would fail when selecting library collections with thousands of variables (now displays variable lists without caching)
- Implemented UI-level caching of library collection data while the plugin is running (this reduces API calls even when library collections cannot be cached in Client Storage)
- Various minor bug fixes and improvements

plugins.name: flowwwww
plugins.description:
Streamline your workflows with flowwwww, the ultimate plugin for creating dynamic connectors between frames, components, and other objects in Figma. Whether you're designing user flows, wireframes, or complex diagrams, flowwwwwempowers you to create professional, customizable connections with ease.


Key Features

Intuitive Connector Creation

Select two frames or components, and flowwwww will instantly generate a connector between them.


Highly Customizable

Personalize your connectors with adjustable properties:

Stroke color and size.

Add text annotations to label your connectors for enhanced clarity.


Smart Obstacle Avoidance

Enable Obstacle Mode to automatically detect and avoid overlapping objects, ensuring clean and unobstructed connectors.

Perfect for complex designs where connectors need to navigate around other elements.



Use Cases

User Flows : Map out user journeys with clear, annotated connectors between screens.

Wireframing : Create structured layouts with precise connections between components.

Technical Diagrams : Build flowcharts, process maps, and other technical illustrations with ease.

Prototyping : Enhance your prototypes with interactive and visually appealing connectors.


How It Works

Install the flowwwww plugin from the Figma Community.

Select two frames, components, or rectangles that you want to connect.


Configure your connector settings (color, style, etc.) via the plugin interface.


Let flowwwww do the rest‚Äîwatch as it creates beautiful, dynamic connectors that adapt to your design.


Why Choose flowwwww?

flowwwww is more than just a connector tool‚Äîit‚Äôs a productivity booster for designers who value precision, flexibility, and efficiency. With its robust feature set and seamless integration into Figma, flowwwww is the go-to solution for anyone looking to elevate their design workflow.


Feedback and Support

We‚Äôre committed to making flowwwww the best it can be! If you have any suggestions, encounter issues, or simply love the plugin, we‚Äôd love to hear from you. Leave a comment on the Figma Community page or reach out to us directly.


Get Started Today

Install flowwwww now and experience the power of effortless connector creation. Simplify your design process and bring your ideas to life with clarity and precision.
